cause.description:
Check out the book at amazon.com: http://www.amazon.com/Knitting-Peace-World-Better-Stitch/dp/1584795336
Knitting is a relaxing passtime, but it is also a great way to send love and much needed items to people who need them.
Check out these organizations for how you can use your favorite hobby to help others:
Revolutionary Knitting Circle: www.knitting.activist.ca
Operation Home Front www.operationhomefront.org
Red Sweaters www.redsweaters.org
Peace Fleece www.peacefleece.com
Afghans for Afghans www.afghnasforafghans.org
Shawl Ministry www.shawlministry.com
Warm Up America! www.warmupamerica.com
Hugs for Homeless Animals www.h4ha.org
Chemo Caps www.chemocaps.com
Project Linus National www.projectlinus.org
For a more complete list, plus patterns and inspirational stories buy the book: Knitting for Peace by Betty Christiansen
1. Knitting is fun.
2. People deserve love and help.
3. Knitting can supply both.
cause.mission: Making the World a Better Place One Stitch at a Time
cause.name: Knitting for Peace
